segment.name: Beginning of message
segment.documentation: BGM, A segment by which the sender must uniquely identify the job order by means of its type and number and, when necessary, its function. The response type may be used to instruct the receiver to give a confirmation message to this message.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying general dates and, when relevant, times related to the whole message. The segment must be specified at least once to identify the document date. The Date/time/period segment within other Segment groups should be used whenever the date or time or period requires to be logically related to another specified data item.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 1: A group of segments identifying the parties with associated information.

segment.name: Party identification
segment.documentation: PNA, A segment identifying names of the parties, in coded or clear form, and their functions relevant to the Job Order Message. Identification of the enterprise and the job administration parties is mandatory for the Job Order Message. It is recommended that, where possible, only the coded form of the party identification should be specified, e.g. where the enterprise and the job administration are known to each other, thus only the coded identification is required.

segment.name: Address
segment.documentation: ADR, A segment indicating the address of the relevant party.

segment.name: Place/location identification
segment.documentation: LOC, A segment giving more specific location information of the party specified in the PNA segment, e.g. internal site or building number.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the date and time related to the PNA segment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 2: A group of segments giving contact details of the specific person or department within the party identified in the PNA segment.

segment.name: Contact information
segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to identify a person or department and their function, to whom communications should be directed.

segment.name: Communication contact
segment.documentation: COM, A segment to identify a communication type and number for the contact specified in the CTA segment, e.g. telephone- number, fax-number, telex-number.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 3: A group of segments for giving references and, where necessary, their dates, relating to the whole message.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment identifying the reference by its number related to the whole message.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the date or time related to the reference.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 4: A group of segments specifying general processing indicators and, when necessary, additional textual information, relevant for the whole message.

segment.name: Processing information
segment.documentation: GEI, A segment specifying general indicators for the whole message.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation:
FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, used when additional information is needed but cannot be accommodated within other segments. In computer to computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.
4.1.2 Detail section
Information to be provided in the Detail section:

segment.name: Section control
segment.documentation: UNS, A mandatory service segment placed before the first user segment in the detail section to avoid segment collision.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 5: A group of segments providing details of the individual offered job or vacancy. There must be at least one occurrence of Segment group 5 within a Job Order Message. This Segment group may be repeated to give information about several other offered jobs or vacancies. The Segment group 5 gives information about the required occupation or profession and may give additional requirements of the job, the remuneration and the arrangements for a job application or interview.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment identifying the offered job by a number, given by the enterprise, e.g. job order number of the enterprise.

segment.name: Range details
segment.documentation: RNG, A segment to identify a range of age for the required person, identified in the DTM of group 6.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying date and, when relevant, time relating to the job offered. Examples of the use of this DTM segment are: order date or time (of the enterprise), expire date (of the job order), required starting date of the job.

segment.name: Quantity
segment.documentation: QTY, A segment identifying the number of vacancies.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 6: A group of segment identifying personal information regarding a job order.

segment.name: Party identification
segment.documentation: PNA, A segment identifying type of identity of a requested person for a job.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying requested limits regarding date of birth.

segment.name: Place/location identification
segment.documentation: LOC, A segment specifying the country, place of residence requested for a person related to the job ordered.

segment.name: Nationality
segment.documentation: NAT, A segment specifying the nationality, or group of nationalities, of a person requested for a job order.

segment.name: Person demographic information
segment.documentation: PDI, A segment indicating requirements regarding gender and marital status for a job.

segment.name: Document/message details
segment.documentation: DOC, A segment indicating which type of document(s) an applicant must have in his possession.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 7: A group of segments specifying general processing indicators and, when necessary, additional textual information, relevant for the job offered.

segment.name: Processing information
segment.documentation: GEI, A segment specifying general indicators related to the job offered.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, used when additional information is needed but cannot be accommodated within other segments. In computer to computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 8: A group of segments for giving references and, where necessary, their dates, relevant to the job offered.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment for specifying references relevant to the job offered.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the date or time related to the reference.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 9: A group of segments identifying requirements or conditions for the job offered.

segment.name: Requirements and conditions
segment.documentation: RCS, A segment to give, in coded form, requirements of a job offered.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment identifying the referenced document by its number and, where appropriate, a line number.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment indicating the date or time details relating to the references.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information for the requirements of the job offered, in coded or clear form, used when additional information is needed but cannot be accommodated within other segments, e.g. advertisement of the job. In computer to computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 10: A group of segments identifying a qualification for the required job and attributes, such as education and experience.

segment.name: Employment details
segment.documentation: EMP, A segment to identify the related area or sector of a qualification and a qualification, in coded or clear form, related to the job offered.

segment.name: Place/location identification
segment.documentation: LOC, A segment indicating the location, where the offered job should be performed.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 11: A group of segments giving coded information about requirements for the profession or job offered regarding educational qualifications and experience and, when necessary, priority of the information and additional textual information.

segment.name: Attribute
segment.documentation: ATT, A segment identifying, in coded form, the requirements for the profession or job offered. The codes are related to education, job experience, special knowledge and required qualifications.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information for special knowledge, in coded or clear form, used when additional information is needed but cannot be accommodated within other segments. In computer to computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.

segment.name: Priority
segment.documentation: PTY, A segment identifying the priority of requirements for a job offered.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 12: A group of segments giving information about languages and experiences of languages.

segment.name: Language
segment.documentation: LAN, A segment specifying a language in coded or clear form.

segment.name: Processing information
segment.documentation: GEI, A segment specifying general indicators of the experience of a language.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 13: A group of segments giving information about the type and the basic conditions of the remuneration offered. It may contain a remuneration amount or a remuneration range and additional remuneration benefits.

segment.name: Remuneration type identification
segment.documentation: SAL, A segment identifying the type of the remuneration offered and, if required, the name of the remuneration type or contract.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information for the remuneration type or contract, in coded or clear form, used when additional information is needed but cannot be accommodated within other segments. In computer to computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the dates and/or times related to the remuneration offered.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 14: A group of segments giving attribute information, in coded form, for the remuneration offered and, where necessary, additional textual information.

segment.name: Attribute
segment.documentation: ATT, A segment identifying additional remuneration information and other benefits offered in coded form. The codes are related to working conditions, working time, employment contract, piece work and remuneration benefits.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information for additional remuneration benefits, in coded or clear form, used when additional information is needed but cannot be accommodated within other segments. In computer to computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 15: A group of segments specifying general processing indicators and, when necessary, additional textual information, relevant for the remuneration offered.

segment.name: Processing information
segment.documentation: GEI, A segment specifying general indicators related to the remuneration offered.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, used when additional information is needed but cannot be accommodated within other segments. In computer to computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 16: A group of segments specifying the type and the amount of the remuneration or a remuneration range offered.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, A segment giving information about the type and the amount of the remuneration offered.

segment.name: Range details
segment.documentation: RNG, A segment to identify a remuneration for the job offered, when an exact remuneration amount in the MOA segment is not available. The remuneration range is related to the type of remuneration in the MOA segment.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, used when additional information is needed but cannot be accommodated within other segments. In computer to computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 17: A group of segments identifying the parties involved with an application or interview of a person for the job with associated information.

segment.name: Party identification
segment.documentation: PNA, A segment identifying names and addresses of the parties, in coded or clear form, and their functions relevant to an application or interview. It is recommended that, where possible, only the coded form of the party identification should be specified, e.g. where the enterprise and the job administration are known to each other, thus only the coded identification is required.

segment.name: Address
segment.documentation: ADR, A segment indicating the address of the relevant party.

segment.name: Processing information
segment.documentation: GEI, A segment specifying an indicator related to an application or interview of a person for this job, e.g. personal, written.

segment.name: Place/location identification
segment.documentation: LOC, A segment giving more specific location information of the party specified in the ADR segment, e.g. internal site or building number for an interview.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information for arrangements for an application or interview, in coded or clear form, used when additional information is needed but cannot be accommodated within other segments. In computer to computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 18: A group of segments for giving date and time information for the application or interview and, when required, additional textual information.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the date and/or time for the application or interview of a person for the job offered.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information for the date and time of the application or interview, in coded or clear form, used when additional information is needed but cannot be accommodated within the DTM segment. In computer to computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 19: A group of segments giving contact details of the specific person or department within the party identified in the PNA segment, e.g. person in the personnel department.

segment.name: Contact information
segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to identify a person or department and their function, to whom communications should be directed.

segment.name: Communication contact
segment.documentation: COM, A segment to identify a communications type and number for the contact specified in the CTA segment, e.g. telephone- number, fax-number, telex-number.
